In order to prevent stakeholders from being surprised about changes to requirements status, it is important to communicate any changes in a timely and transparent manner. This includes communicating the status change to all relevant stakeholders, updating any relevant documentation (such as the traceability matrix), and ensuring that the requirement’s source is aware of the change. By keeping everyone informed about changes to requirements status, the project team can avoid surprises and ensure that everyone is on the same page.

D. Requirements traceability matrix
The most valuable item for a business analyst to provide in this situation would be the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM).
The RTM is a tool used to track requirements throughout the project life cycle. It provides a clear and concise view of which requirements have been implemented, which are still in progress, and which have not yet been started. This is useful for project sponsors to see which requirements will be implemented and to help ensure that all requirements are met by the end of the project.
The Requirements Baseline Document (A) is a record of the final approved project requirements. It is used as a reference point throughout the project to ensure that the project stays on track and that any changes made are approved and documented.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In this situation, the business analyst should first verify that the test case is correct before taking any other action. Therefore, option C, "verify that the test case is incorrect" would be the correct first step for the business analyst.

The situation could have been avoided if option B, "a change control process for requirements and their statuses was followed."

A change control process for requirements and their statuses is a formal process for managing changes to project requirements. This process typically includes identifying the requirements that need to be changed, documenting the proposed changes, evaluating the impact of the changes, obtaining approval for the changes, and implementing the changes.
